definition: Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Hanfeizi has reflected Hanfei's political viewpoint in a concentrated way.
sentences.chinese: 《韓非子》集中反映了韓非的政治觀點。

sentences.english: Hanfeizi is one of the most important writings in warring states period.
sentences.chinese: 《韓非子》是我國戰國末期的一部重要文獻。

sentences.english: The second chapter "Han Feizi" cites the historical facts reflection the thought.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是《韓非子》稱引故實反映的思想。

sentences.english: Han Fei-tzu sat in lotus position on the bare wooden floor beside his wife's sickbed.
sentences.chinese: 韓非子坐在她妻子的病牀旁，光木地板上的蓮座裏。

sentences.english: The Comparison of Mind Theory from Shyun Tze and Han Fei …
sentences.chinese: 荀子論心和韓非子所蘊涵的心論之比較研究。

sentences.english: Rebelliously, Han Fei-tzu gave her the most false answer to her question.
sentences.chinese: 韓非子難以控制的給了她最錯誤的答案。

sentences.english: The compilation of Hanfeizi is a relatively long process.
sentences.chinese: 《韓非子》的編集是一個較長的過程。

definition: The School Sayings of Confucius, a supplement to the Analects/abbr. to 家語|家语[Jia1 yu3]
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar

lit. “Mr. Lü's Spring and Autumn (Annals)”, compendium of the philosophies of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1], compiled around 239 BC under the patronage of Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
Rizhilu or Record of daily study, by early Confucian philosopher Gu Yanwu 顧炎武|顾炎武
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
to check and correct
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
Cheng Yi (1033-1107), Song neo-Confucian scholar
sound and meaning
commentary and subcommentary (of a book)
